alert.note: Alert for Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 6:18AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northeast Washington, including the following county, Stevens. * WHEN...Until 815 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 614 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated rain in excess of an inch and a half due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chewelah, Valley, Chewelah Peak, 49 Degrees North and Addy. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
